result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Joseph Wolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Joseph Wolf

records.addlTxt: Finger Print/DNA Proof of Submission

12:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Douglas J Drexler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew Joseph Wolf in court.  Attorney Russ S. Kort appeared by video for Andrew Joseph Wolf.  Court calls 22CF6 & 22CM12. State moves to dismiss ct. 2, 3, 4 in case 22CF6.  Court dismisses cts 2-4 on 22CF6 upon State's motion.  Defendant pleads no contest to 22CM12 & Ct 1 on 22CF6. Plea is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently given. Constitutional rights read and waived. Court finds defendant guilty due to no contest plea in 22CM12 & in Ct 1 of 22CF6. Statement by State. Statement by Attorney Kort. Court withholds sentence and places defendant of probation for two years with conditions: AODA assessment with follow through, may not enter any bars or taverns, not to consume or possess alcohol, may not possess or consume marijuana, complete 40 hours community service, obtain full time employment, if unemployed must seek 3 jobs per month and provide written proof,, must attend 1 AA/NA meeting per week, serve 60 days jail, must report on or before 9/19/22 at 8:30am, pay court costs within 60 days of release of incarceration or commitment order, must submit DNA sample, credit for 3 days if revoked.  22CM12 - Court imposes $500 fine plus costs and restitution of $96.50 to be paid within 60 days or commitment order. Appeal rights given. Adj. 1:10pm jjm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 12:45 pm.
Motion hearing on August 16, 2022 at 12:45 pm.
